benchmark_details.name: OpenGVL - Benchmarking Visual Temporal Progress for Data Curation
benchmark_details.overview: OpenGVL is a comprehensive benchmark for estimating task progress across diverse challenging manipulation tasks involving both robotic and human embodiments, aimed at improving data curation in robotics through reliable temporal task completion predictions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized framework for benchmarking temporal progress prediction systems in robotics and serve as a tool for data curation.

data.source: Various robotics datasets including nyu door, berkeley mvp, cmu stretch, and nyu franka
data.annotation: Automatically generated using the Value-Order Correlation (VOC) metric

methodology.calculation: VOC measures the rank correlation between predicted task completion percentages and the ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: A higher VOC score indicates better alignment between predictions and actual task completion.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison to proprietary models shows open-source models achieve approximately 60-70% of the performance.
methodology.validation: Benchmark validation through hidden datasets to prevent contamination.
